name: BuildSsisProjectTask
description: Build SSIS Project using Microsoft SSIS DevOps Tools
author: Dr. John Tunnicliffe

inputs.name: project
inputs.label: File path of the dtproj file to be built.
inputs.helpMarkDown: File path of the dtproj file to be built.

inputs.name: output
inputs.label: Output path of the build artifact
inputs.helpMarkDown: Output path of the build artifact. The value of this argument will overwrite the default output path in the project configuration.

inputs.name: configuration
inputs.label: Build configuration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the project configuration to be used for build. If not supplied, it defaults to the first defined project configuration in the dtproj file.

inputs.name: projectPassword
inputs.label: Password for the SSIS project when encrypted
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password of the SSIS project and its packages. This argument is only valid when the protection level of the SSIS project and packages is EncryptSensitiveWithPassword or EncryptAllWithPassword. For package deployment model, all packages must share the same password specified by this argument.

inputs.name: stripSensitive
inputs.label: Protection Level
inputs.helpMarkDown: Convert the protection level of the SSIS project to DontSaveSensitve. When protection level is EncryptSensitiveWithPassword or EncryptAllWithPassword, the argument -projectPassword must be correctly set. This option is only valid for project deployment model.

inputs.name: logLevel
inputs.label: Level of logging to be written to the output
inputs.helpMarkDown: Only logs with equal or higher logging level will be written to the log file.
